Question.Text: What is the current visibility of your main social media profiles?
Question.A: Public with my real name
Question.C: Private or friends-only
Question.D: Mixed settings or I am not sure

Question.Text: Who can tag you or see your location tags by default on social platforms?
Question.A: Anyone
Question.C: Only me OR tagging/location is disabled

Question.Text: How often do you limit app permissions (camera, microphone, location) on your phone?
Question.A: Rarely or never
Question.C: Regularly
Question.D: I do not know how to review them

Question.Text: In the last 30 days, has your device done any of the following?
Question.A: It overheats or drains quickly and I noticed an unknown “device admin” app
Question.B: There are occasional slowdowns or pop-ups
Question.C: Everything seems normal

Question.Text: What is your current setup for two-factor authentication (2FA) on important accounts (email, banking, school, etc.)?
Question.A: No 2FA enabled OR I do not know what 2FA is or how to use it
Question.B: SMS-based 2FA on some accounts (text messages or phone calls)
Question.C: An authenticator app on most accounts
Question.D: A hardware security key for critical logins

Question.Text: Which option best describes your password habits across accounts?
Question.A: I reuse the same or very similar passwords
Question.B: I reuse with small changes (e.g., adding “!”)
Question.C: I use unique passwords with a password manager
Question.D: I have a mix of unique and reused passwords

Question.Text: How often do you post strong opinions or personal views online using your real name?
Question.A: Often
Question.C: Rarely
Question.D: Never, or I use a pseudonym

Question.Text: Have you recently encountered profiles or videos that appear AI-generated or manipulated?
Question.A: Yes
Question.C: No

Question.Text: How often do you use public Wi-Fi?
Question.A: Often and I perform sensitive tasks (banaking or portals) on it
Question.C: Rarely and not for sensitive tasks

Question.Text: Do you use a Virtual Private Network (VPN) when you are outside your home network or traveling?
Question.A: I never use a VPN OR I don't know what a VPN is
Question.C: I use a VPN for sensitive tasks

Question.Text: How do you typically access your bank or financial accounts online?
Question.A: I click links from emails or texts
Question.B: I sometimes use links from messages
Question.C: I only use typed URLs or official apps
Question.D: It varies or I am not sure

Question.Text: How do you handle job-offer or recruiter messages that include links or attachments?
Question.A: I often engage with them (e.g., clicking on links)
Question.C: I verify the credibility of the message before interacting OR I ignore them
Question.D: I have not received any of these messages

Question.Text: What best describes your current use of dating apps?
Question.A: I actively use multiple apps
Question.B: I am actively use one app
Question.C: I am not using any dating apps

Question.Text: How often do you verify the identity of new contacts before you engage deeply?
Question.A: Never
Question.C: Usually or always
Question.D: I am not sure how to verify

Question.Text: How is your home Wi-Fi router currently configured?
Question.A: Default admin or SSID; I do not know the WPA mode
Question.C: WPA3 with a separate guest network

Question.Text: How often do you check for hidden cameras or unknown devices in private spaces (hotel rooms, rentals, etc.)?
Question.A: Never
Question.C: Regularly using RF/network/visual checks
Question.D: I am not sure what to do

Question.Text: Where do you typically get mobile apps from?
Question.A: I download them from websites, social media, or advertisements
Question.B: Mostly from official stores with a few from other sources
Question.C: Only from the official app store

Question.Text: How restrictive are your messaging-app privacy settings (read receipts, “last seen,” profile visibility)?
Question.A: They are mostly public or at I use the default option
Question.C: They are restricted and private

Question.Text: How prepared are you for account recovery (email security and backup codes) if you lose access?
Question.A: No backups and weak email security
Question.C: Authenticator codes with stored backups

Question.Text: How often do you delete old public posts and/or remove yourself from data broker sites?
Question.A: Never
Question.C: A few times a year
Question.D: I am not sure how to do that

Question.Text: How do you react to an “urgent” security email about one of your accounts?
Question.A: I use the link in the message
Question.B: I go to the site name and then log in
Question.C: I open a saved bookmark or the official app only
Question.D: I ignore the message OR verify separately later

Question.Text: Who is currently allowed to message you by default on your social platforms?
Question.A: Anyone (open DMs)
Question.C: Friends only

Question.Text: How often do you use shared or public computers (e.g., libraries, labs) for online activities?
Question.A: Often and I perform sensitive taks (banking, portals) on it
Question.C: Rarely and never for sensitive tasks

Question.Text: Which of the following steps do you take after using a share or public computer?
Question.A: I do not do any of these steps
Question.C: I use a private window, sign out, and/or do not save credentials
Question.D: I avoid shared computers and use only my own devices

Question.Text: How do you typically share photos and location details online?
Question.A: I frequently post my current location or my home
Question.B: I occasionally share my current location
Question.C: I rarely share or I delay posts until I have left that location
Question.D: I never share my location or I am not sure

Question.Text: How closely do you monitor your financial accounts and banking alerts?
Question.A: I never review statements or alerts
Question.C: I have alerts on and review my accounts weekly

Question.Text: How do you let visitors connect to your home internet?
Question.A: I give out the main Wi-Fi password
Question.B: I sometimes share a guest network
Question.C: I always use a separate guest network for visitors

Question.Text: How do you handle follow requests from people you do not recognize?
Question.A: I accept most requests
Question.B: I skim profiles and then accept or deny
Question.C: I only accept people I know

Question.Text: How often do you update your apps and operating system?
Question.A: Rarely OR never
Question.C: Auto-updates are enabled
Question.D: I am not sure how to update

Question.Text: What is your plan if any of your devices (phone, laptop, etc.) are lost or stolen?
Question.A: I have no backups or device lock (e.g., password, facial ID)
Question.B: Some devices are backed up and I have a basic lock (e.g., 4-digit password)
Question.C: All of my devices are backed up and I have a strong lock

Question.Text: How often do you use private browsers or privacy-centric search engines?
Question.A: Never
Question.C: Often OR always

Question.Text: How do you handle attachments from unknown senders?
Question.A: I open them frequently
Question.B: I sometimes open them after a quick glance
Question.C: I never open them
Question.D: I scan first or verify the authenticity of the sender

Question.Text: Which of the following best describes how you use hotel or Airbnb Wi-Fi?
Question.A: I log in to banking or other private site
Question.B: I only use it for general browsing
Question.C: I use a VPN for any sensitive activity
Question.D: I use only my mobile hotspot

Question.Text: What can be seen in your phone’s lock-screen notifications?
Question.A: The entire notification can be viewed
Question.B: Only some messages can be viewed
Question.C: The notification is hidden OR all notifications are turned off

Question.Text: Do you scan your spaces or networks for unknown or suspicious devices?
Question.A: No
Question.C: Yes, with RF or network checks
Question.D: I am unsure how to do this

Question.Text: How many of the following describe your lived experience (either now or in the past): woman-identifying; part of a marginalized group; LGBTQ+; neurodivergent; third-culture background; survived emotional abuse/coercive control; often suppressing parts of yourself to fit in; destabilizing experiences where you should have felt safe; a mental-health condition; a recent major life transition?
Question.A: 0–1 of these apply to me
Question.C: 4–6 of these apply to me
Question.D: 7 or more of these apply to me

Question.Text: Which option best describes your current relationship status?
Question.A: Single and/or actively dating
Question.C: Recently ended a relationship

Question.Text: Has a partner (past or present) ever asked for or accessed your digital accounts, devices, or location sharing?
Question.A: Yes
Question.C: I am unsure

Question.Text: Do you fear being targeted by online harassment (for example: stalking, smear campaigns, or doxxing)?
Question.A: Yes
Question.C: I am unsure

Question.Text: Have you ever felt like someone had access to your thoughts, feelings, or patterns — even without direct access to your devices?
Question.A: Yes
Question.C: I am unsure
